p: The A/VIT/15/2012 virus was passed once through cattle tongue, using standard procedures [ 25] and a 10% (w/v) suspension of the lesion material prepared in Minimum Essential Medium with Hanksâ€™ salts with 2% fetal calf serum (FBS) and 2% antibiotics mix (Penicillin 10 5 IU/100 mL, Streptomycin 0.1g/100 mL, Mycostatin 5 x 10 4 IU/100 mL, Polymyxin B 15x10 3 IU/100 mL and Kanamycin 0.1g/100 mL). The titer was 10 7.8 plaque-forming units (PFU)/mL, as determined on secondary lamb kidney cells and 10 7.3 cattle infective dose (CID) 50/mL, when titrated in cattle tongue.
